intro: Lonicera chrysantha var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features opposite, ovate leaves that are typically 3–6 inches long and have a smooth, dark green upper surface. The plant produces fragrant, yellowish-orange flowers in late spring, which are followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in partial to full sun and prefers well-drained soil. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and wildlife benefits.
